entities.description: A unit used to measure the quantity of substances in the survey.
The count of cases in the survey reporting a specific measurement unit, without adjustments for survey design.
Specific measurement examples including Gram, Kilogram, Ounce, Pound, Milliliter, Liter, Fluid Ounce, Gallon, Dosage Unit/Items, and Number of Plants.
Indicates the cases where data is unknown or missing.

relationships.description: The relationship indicating a specific substance measurement involves a specific unit.
The relationship linking each measurement unit to its reported frequency in the survey data.
Indicates the link between the survey data and instances where data is missing or unknown.
